title: Chapter XX.
content: Of Space. The Stoics and Epicureans make a place, a vacuum, and space to differ. A vacuum is that which is void of anything that may be called a body; place is that which is possessed by a body; a space that which is partly filled with a body, as a cask with wine. Chapter XXI.

book.title: Concerning Nature
